required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Gut Leakage Markers and Microbiota Signature in Coronary Artery Disease.
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Gut Leakage Markers and Microbiota Signature in Coronary Artery Disease.

brief_summary.textblock: Define a signature of gut microbiota composition and related metabolites in patients with ST-elevation myocardial infarction, non ST-elevation myocardial infarction and chronic coronary disease (CAD).

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 200 patients, allocated to 50 patients with chronic coronary syndrome, 75 patients with non-ST elevation myocardial infarction and 75 patients with ST- elevation myocardial infarction will be included. Clinical information, blood samples and fecal samples will be collected. Fecal and blood samples will be collected once in patients With chronic disease and in patients with acute coronary syndrome; in the acute phase and after 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Microbiota alpha diversity in myocardial infarction measured as Chao1 Index.
primary_outcome.description: fecal-sample. 16srRNA (Miseq) will be used for sequencing.

primary_outcome.measure: Microbiota alpha diversity in myocardial infarction measured as Chao1 Index

primary_outcome.description: Blood sample. Analyses will be performed with ELISA.

arm_group.description: 75 patients with non ST-elevation myocardial infarction
75 patients with ST segment-elevation myocardial infarction

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood, Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC), feces

study_pop.textblock: Patients aged 20-75 years with coronary artery disease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Coronary heart disease verified by coronary angiography
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current infection requiring intravenous antibiotics
- Inflammatory bowel disease
- Renal failure with creatinine > 200µmol/L
- Hepatic impairment
- Pregnancy
- Previous bariatric surgery
- Colostomy
- Active malignant disease

facility.name: Department of Cardiology, Oslo University Hospital Ullevål

patient_data.ipd_description: Study protocol, informed consent form (in Norwegian) and clinical study report will be shared by request.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data become available 01.06.2022, and will be available until 01.06.2023.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Requests by email will be answered.
